name: intern
context:
Company Name: BrightWave Technologies
Industry: Software Development

1. Working Hours
- Standard working hours are 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM, Monday to Friday.
- Employees may take a 1-hour lunch break anytime between 12:00 PM and 3:00 PM.

2. Leave Policy
- Employees get 12 paid leaves per year.
- Prior approval is required from the reporting manager for planned leaves.
- Emergencies should be communicated as soon as possible.

3. Remote Work Guidelines
- Remote work is allowed up to 2 days per week.
- Employees must be reachable during working hours on Slack.
- Daily standups must be attended over video call.

4. Code of Conduct
- All employees must maintain a respectful and inclusive work environment.
- Sharing confidential company information outside the organization is strictly prohibited.
- Harassment of any kind will lead to disciplinary action.

5. IT & Equipment
- New employees receive a laptop, charger, backpack, and ID card on Day 1.
- For any technical issue, raise a ticket through the internal IT Support Portal.
- Replacement accessories require manager approval.

6. Common Tools Used
- Slack for communication  
- GitHub for version control  
- Notion for documentation  
- Jira for task management

7. Probation Period
- The probation period lasts for 3 months.
- Performance is reviewed at the end of the probation.
- Permanent employment is confirmed based on performance, punctuality, and teamwork.

8. Expense Reimbursements
- Travel expenses for official work are reimbursable.
- Food expenses are reimbursed only during approved business travel.
- Original bills must be uploaded to the finance portal.

End of Document.
creator: moulisrivastava5@gmail.com

name: Manal
context:
Product Name: LumiHome Smart Hub
Version: 2.1.4
Category: Smart Home Automation Device

1. Overview
- The LumiHome Smart Hub acts as the central controller for all LumiHome smart devices.
- It supports up to 50 connected devices.
- The hub requires an active Wi-Fi connection to function.

2. Setup Instructions
- Plug the Smart Hub into a power outlet using the provided adapter.
- Download the “LumiHome App” from the App Store or Google Play.
- Connect the hub to your home Wi-Fi network through the app’s setup wizard.
- Once connected, pair your smart devices using the “Add Device” option in the app.

3. Supported Devices
- LumiHome Smart Bulbs
- LumiHome Motion Sensors
- LumiHome Door/Window Sensors
- LumiHome Smart Plugs
- LumiHome Thermostat

4. LED Indicator Guide
- Solid Blue: Hub is functioning normally.
- Blinking Blue: Hub is attempting to connect to Wi-Fi.
- Solid Red: No network connection.
- Blinking Red: Firmware update in progress.
- Yellow: Device pairing mode is active.

5. Security Features
- End-to-end encryption for all device communication.
- Two-factor authentication available in the app.
- Guests can be added with limited permissions for controlling devices.

6. Maintenance & Updates
- Firmware updates are automatically downloaded when the hub is connected to Wi-Fi.
- The device should be kept in a cool, dry place to prevent overheating.
- Use only the provided power adapter to avoid damage.

7. Troubleshooting
- If devices are not connecting, try restarting the hub by unplugging and plugging it back in.
- For Wi-Fi issues, verify your password in the LumiHome App.
- If the hub shows a solid red light, reconfigure the Wi-Fi settings through the app.

8. Warranty Information
- The LumiHome Smart Hub includes a 1-year limited warranty.
- Warranty covers manufacturing defects only.
- Physical damage, water damage, or use of non-original accessories voids the warranty.

End of Document.
creator: moulisrivastava5@gmail.com
